channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil Steady But on Track for Significant Weekly Loss
item.description: Oil prices were broadly stable in early European trading with concerns over sluggish demand in China weighed heavily on prices, but crude still findin...

item.title: A Mystery $30 Million Wave of Pro-Trump Bets Has Moved a Popular Prediction Market
item.description: Four Polymarket accounts have systematically placed frequent bets on a Trump election victory.

item.title: Chinese equities jump as central bank rolls out support for the stock market
item.description: Chinese stocks rallied Friday for the first time in four days as the central bank rolled out promised support for the stock market.

item.title: Retail investors are trading stocks like the pros — so brokers are giving them the tools they want
item.description: As retail investors get more sophisticated, Robinhood has tried to, as well.

item.title: Gold may not reach a price ceiling anytime soon. Here’s why.

item.title: America is doing better than the media or our politicians tell us. Here’s proof.
item.description: Washington, D.C. doesn’t work. You know what does? America itself.

item.title: Can Netflix Keep Flexing Its Pricing Muscle?
item.description: The streaming giant’s ad business is taking time to catch on, which will make price hikes unavoidable if subscriber growth slows.

item.title: Sterling Rises to 2.5-Year High Versus Euro After Strong U.K. Retail Sales

item.title: Stock Futures Rise as Netflix Stock Jumps on Earnings
item.description: Futures tied to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 rose while stocks in Chinas rallied.

item.title: A lot of your personal wealth is tied up in your employer. How to spread out the risk.
item.description: Direct indexing and individualized portfolios can help an investor avoid overexposure to an employer’s stock
